TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MultiplayerManager extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class contains APIs for matchmaking, player roster, and multiplayer session management.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool AutoFillMembersDuringMatchmaking { get; set; }
.property instance bool AutoFillMembersDuringMatchmaking
Public Property AutoFillMembersDuringMatchmaking As Boolean
member this.AutoFillMembersDuringMatchmaking : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the game should auto fill open slots during gameplay. If set to true, it finds members via matchmaking to fill open slots during gameplay. This can be changed anytime.

Docs.summary: Cancels the match request on the server, if one exists.

MemberSignature.Value: public Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVectorView<Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerEvent> DoWork ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVectorView`1<class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerEvent> DoWork() runtime managed
Public Function DoWork () As IVectorView(Of MultiplayerEvent)

abstract member DoWork : unit -> Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVectorView<Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerEvent> override this.DoWork : unit -> Windows.Foundation.Collections.IVectorView<Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerEvent>

Docs.summary: Ensures proper game state updates are maintained between the title and the Xbox Live Multiplayer Service.
Docs.returns: A list of all callback events for the game to handle. Empty if no events are triggered during this update.
Docs.remarks: To ensure the best performance, DoWork() must be called frequently, at least once per frame. The title needs to be thread safe when calling DoWork() since this is when the state will change. For example, if you looping through the list of game session members, the list may change when DoWork() is called.

Docs.summary: Estimated wait time for a match request to be matched with other members. Only applies after find_match() has been called.

Docs.param: The ticket attributes for the match. (Optional)
The maximum time to wait for members to join the match. (Optional)
Docs.summary: Sends a matchmaking request to the server. When a match is found, the manager will join the game and notify the title via the FindMatchCompleted event.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerGameSession GameSession { get; }

Public ReadOnly Property GameSession As MultiplayerGameSession

Docs.summary: A collection of members that are part of your game session. When a member accepts a game invite, they will be added to the lobby and the game session (if there is room). You can call leave_game() to leave the game.

Docs.summary: Indicates JoinInProgressState on who can join your game.

MemberSignature.Value: public void JoinGame (string sessionName, string sessionTemplateName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void JoinGame([in]string sessionName, [in]string sessionTemplateName) runtime managed
Public Sub JoinGame (sessionName As String, sessionTemplateName As String)
abstract member JoinGame : string * string -> unit override this.JoinGame : string * string -> unit

Docs.param: A unique name for the session.
The name of the template for the game session to be based on.
Docs.summary: Joins a game given a globally unique session name. Callers can get the unique session name as a result of the title's third party matchmaking.
Docs.remarks: The result is delivered via MultiplayerEvent callback of type JoinGameCompleted through DoWork(). After joining, you can set the properties or the host via GameSession()::SetSynchronized APIs.

MemberSignature.Value: public void JoinGameFromLobby (string sessionTemplateName);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void JoinGameFromLobby([in]string sessionTemplateName) runtime managed
Public Sub JoinGameFromLobby (sessionTemplateName As String)
abstract member JoinGameFromLobby : string -> unit override this.JoinGameFromLobby : string -> unit

Docs.param: The name of the template for the game session to be based on.
Docs.summary: Join the lobby's game session if one exists and if there is room. If the session doesn't exist, it creates a new game session with the existing lobby members.
Docs.remarks: The result is delivered via MultiplayerEvent callback of type JoinGameCompleted through DoWork(). This does not migrate existing lobby session properties over to the game session. After joining, you can set the properties or the host via GameSession()::SetSynchronized APIs.

MemberSignature.Value: public void JoinLobby (string handleId, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser user);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void JoinLobby([in]string handleId, [in]class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser user) runtime managed
Public Sub JoinLobby (handleId As String, user As XboxLiveUser)
abstract member JoinLobby : string * Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser -> unit override this.JoinLobby : string * Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser -> unit

Docs.param: A multiplayer handle id, which uniquely identifies the lobby session you want to join.
The Xbox Live user joining the lobby.
Docs.summary: Joins an Xbox Live user to the lobby identified by a session handle id.
Docs.remarks: A handle is a service-side pointer to a game session. The handleId is a GUID identifier of the handle. Callers will usually get the handleId from another member's MultiplayerActivityDetails. Optionally, if you haven't added the local users through lobbySession()::AddlocalUser(), you can pass in the list of users via the Joinlobby() API. The result is delivered via MultiplayerEvent callback of type JoinGameCompleted through DoWork(). After joining, you can set the host via MultiplayerGameSession::SetSynchronizedHost() if one doesn't exist.

MemberSignature.Value: public void JoinLobby (Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.IProtocolActivatedEventArgs eventArgs, Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser user);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void JoinLobby([in]class Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.IProtocolActivatedEventArgs eventArgs, [in]class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser user) runtime managed
Public Sub JoinLobby (eventArgs As IProtocolActivatedEventArgs, user As XboxLiveUser)

abstract member JoinLobby : Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.IProtocolActivatedEventArgs * Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser -> unit override this.JoinLobby : Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.IProtocolActivatedEventArgs * Microsoft.Xbox.Services.System.XboxLiveUser -> unit

Docs.param: The IProtocolActivatedEventArgs when the title is protocol activated.
The system User joining the lobby.
Docs.summary: Joins an Xbox Live user to a lobby via the specified IProtocolActivatedEventArgs.
Docs.remarks:
The IProtocolActivatedEventArgs provides arguments for protocol activation. If the user accepts an invite or joined a friends game via a shell UI, the title will get a protocol activation. The result is delivered via JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs() callback through DoWork().
Optionally, if you haven't added the local users through LobbySession()::AddLocalUser(), you can pass in the list of users via the JoinLobby() API. If the invited user is not added either via LobbySession()::AddLocalUser() or through JoinLobby(), then JoinLobby() will fail and provide the InvitedXboxUserId that the invite was sent for as part of the JoinLobbyCompletedEventArgs() After joining, you can set the host via GameSession::SetSynchronizedHost() if one doesn't exist.

Public Sub LeaveGame ()
abstract member LeaveGame : unit -> unit override this.LeaveGame : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Leaves the current game session and returns the users back into the lobby. This removes all local users from the game.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerLobbySession LobbySession { get; }
.property instance class Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerLobbySession LobbySession
Public ReadOnly Property LobbySession As MultiplayerLobbySession
member this.LobbySession : Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.MultiplayerLobbySession

Docs.summary: A collection of members that you have invited to your lobby. When a member accepts a game invite, they will be added to the lobby and the game session. Users found via matchmaking will not be added in the lobby.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetJoinInProgress (Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.Joinability value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetJoinInProgress([in]valuetype Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.Joinability value) runtime managed
Public Sub SetJoinInProgress (value As Joinability)
abstract member SetJoinInProgress : Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.Joinability -> unit override this.SetJoinInProgress : Microsoft.Xbox.Services.Multiplayer.Manager.Joinability -> unit

Docs.summary: Restricts who can join the game. Defaults to "enabled", meaning only local users and users who are followed by an existing member of the lobby can join without an invite.
Docs.remarks: Changes are batched and written to the service on the next DoWork(). All session properties and members contain updated response returned from the server upon calling DoWork().
